meaningMnemonic:
If you <kanji>announce</kanji> something <kanji>beforehand</kanji> you will have <vocabulary>advance notice</vocabulary>. Advance notice is always nice to give.

You'll also see this used as an abbreviation of 予告編, meaning <vocabulary>trailer</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>preview</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
